{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Judet view is a type of X-ray view. It is not used for the calcaneum, which is a bone in the foot, nor the scaphoid, which is a bone in the wrist. It is also not used for the shoulder. The Judet view is used for the pelvis, specifically to visualize fractures of the acetabulum, which is part of the hip joint.", "answer_choice": "D"}
